summary: explain a film plot badly:endgame
body:
explain a film plot badly:endgame

apparently there are major spoilers ahead for those few who don’t seem to have watched a4 yet


wannabe superheroes that have named themselves after some pilot travel back in time to restore humans’ lives by single-handedly turning to ash a serial killer single father that loves purple and has a weird chin that tried to end universal hunger by a process which required 6 colorful stones, snapping, and some murder in the process.

summary: Bucky x reader - The Frozen City Day fifteen: Your character has never laughed so hard…what made them do that? -...
body:
Bucky x reader - The Frozen City

Day fifteen: Your character has never laughed so hard…what made them do that? - @sdavid09 

By the time Bucky the ice around him the city had fallen silent. There were no cars driving, no people in asking about. Running to his room, he tried to figure out what to bring. He threw on a heavy coat, and went to grab his gun before hesitating. Bucky shook his head and stuffed the gun into his pocket before sprinting all the way to the lower floor.

Barging through the door, he was hit by a blast of cold air. All around snow had built up, and where he was standing it was up to his knees. He could barely see 3 feet in front of him as snow heavily rained down.

“Shit…” he cursed quietly.

Pulling the tower door shut, he made his way down the drive. Putting everything he had into shifting the thick piles of snow.

He didn’t know where to go. Where would you go? You could be anywhere and the city was huge! Grumbling, he made his way in a random direction hoping it would lead him to you. All along the way there, he could see half covered snow men that children must have made first loving the snow. The power was off, there was no lights. Everything was just black.

“(Y/N)?!” He yelled, hoping it would work.

Nothing. Sighing heavily, Bucky carried on. He wasn’t going to stop until he found you.

Minutes ticked by and he was walking along side a large building when he heard it. Rustling, spinning around he waited, but nothing happened so he carried on his way. Only to hear it again, spinning around there was still nothing there. That’s when he spotted it, a light in the distance getting closer.

It got closer and closer until something kicked him down into the snow. Sending it flying upwards. On top of him was something warm and light. Opening an eye, he gasped.

“Hey bud!” He laughed.

It was your dog, his flaming body wasn’t hot enough to melt the snow but it was hot enough to warm up Buckys freezing body. The dog licked his face causing Bucky to laugh even more. He was beyond happy, this could be how he finds you, not only that but he could finally see in front of himself.

The dog got of, jumping around and yipping. Waiting for Bucky to get up before diving into the snow and jumping back out causing Bucky to laugh again. Sure, it was a bad situation, but a good laugh was what he needed to lift his hopes up. Kneeling down, Bucky took the dogs flaming head between his hands, glancing around before looking back at him.

“Where is she? Where’s (Y/N)?”

The dog whined, before it turned around and begun to run the way it had came from. Occasionally stopping to let Bucky catch up before running off again. After what felt like hours of running through the snow, Bucky finally fell to his knees, the cold was getting to much for him and his lungs ached.

The dog, which he had decided to name Bud, licked his face and let out a whine, laying on the snow next to him. The freezing air stung Buckys lungs. He laid down, facing the sky as he watched his breath flow up. The snow fell down, covering him in little white specks, if someone wasn’t looking closely he would have looked dead, with his pale skin, his slow breathing.

“I don’t think I can keep this up Bud.” He sighed.

Bud whined again and crawled closer, nudging Bucky with his nose. Letting out another sigh, Bucky closed his eyes, his body felt like it was failing him, and he was ready to let it all go when he heard shouting.

“Bucky!….”

“Steve!?”

Shooting up, Bucky held Bud, the crunching of snow now reached his ears and Steve came into view. Dropping to his knees in front of his best friend. Nat and Clint followed behind and did the same thing. Occupying themselves with the dog.

“We found you…” he gasped.

“Where are the others?”

“Back at the tower, we came out to try find out.”

Bucky nodded, getting a better look at his friend, he couldn’t help but snicker. The snicker soon growing into full blown laughter much to Steve’s confusment. Bucky triedto contain his amusement but he couldn’t, and laughter shook his body. Nat and Clint took one look at Steve and noticed it to.

“What’s so funny?”

“You um… you have a…” Bucky pointed just above Steve’s lip Where somehow he managed to gain a snowtash.

Steve chuckled, wiping it away as he waited for Bucky to calm down. It took a while, Bucky hadn’t laughed like that for ages but he was finally calm and ready to be serious.

“We need to head back, it’s not safe.” Steve sighed, rubbing his hands up and down his arms.

“I can’t… I can’t leave her out here.”

“Buck, you’ll freeze. Jarvis said you left hours ago! We thought you would have froze to death by now.”

“I would have if it weren’t for Bud.”

Steve glanced at the dog but didn’t say anything. Clint shuffled forward, only his eyes were visible through the heavy clothing he wore.

“Fury called us, he’s-“ “I don’t care what he said!” Bucky snapped.

“Barnes it’s not-“

Nat was cut off by Bud jumping up growling and barking behind Bucky. Turning around, he pulled out his gun, praying it wasn’t as he took aim. A figure slowly walked forward, before stopping just outside the lights reach. But they could see the eyes, Bucky knew them eyes. Dropping his gun, he held a hand out.

“(Y/N)…”

TAGS:

Marvel: @emiwrites3reads @captainmarvel16 @darth-dorle @stiffinme @startrekkingaroundasgard

All: @sitkafay @havlindzk @drakelover78

At first sight: @stiffinme @shootingstarsaretearsofheaven @colie87 @isabella212 @kiliakit @tynabyna @theharlequinwriter @leenat23 @theactualscarletwitch @nayr9e

“Shit…” he cursed quietly.

All along the way there, he could see half covered snow men that children must have made first loving the snow. The power was off, there was no lights. Everything was just black.

“(Y/N)?!” He yelled, hoping it would work.

Nothing. Sighing heavily, Bucky carried on. He wasn’t going to stop until he found you.

Minutes ticked by and he was walking along side a large building when he heard it. Rustling, spinning around he waited, but nothing happened so he carried on his way. Only to hear it again, spinning around there was still nothing there. That’s when he spotted it, a light in the distance getting closer.

It got closer and closer until something kicked him down into the snow. Sending it flying upwards. On top of him was something warm and light. Opening an eye, he gasped.

“Hey bud!” He laughed.

It was your dog, his flaming body wasn’t hot enough to melt the snow but it was hot enough to warm up Buckys freezing body. The dog licked his face causing Bucky to laugh even more. He was beyond happy, this could be how he finds you, not only that but he could finally see in front of himself.

The dog got of, jumping around and yipping. Waiting for Bucky to get up before diving into the snow and jumping back out causing Bucky to laugh again. Sure, it was a bad situation, but a good laugh was what he needed to lift his hopes up. Kneeling down, Bucky took the dogs flaming head between his hands, glancing around before looking back at him.

“Where is she? Where’s (Y/N)?”

After what felt like hours of running through the snow, Bucky finally fell to his knees, the cold was getting to much for him and his lungs ached.

The dog, which he had decided to name Bud, licked his face and let out a whine, laying on the snow next to him. The freezing air stung Buckys lungs. He laid down, facing the sky as he watched his breath flow up. The snow fell down, covering him in little white specks, if someone wasn’t looking closely he would have looked dead, with his pale skin, his slow breathing.

“I don’t think I can keep this up Bud.” He sighed.

Bud whined again and crawled closer, nudging Bucky with his nose. Letting out another sigh, Bucky closed his eyes, his body felt like it was failing him, and he was ready to let it all go when he heard shouting.

“Bucky!….”

“Steve!?”

Shooting up, Bucky held Bud, the crunching of snow now reached his ears and Steve came into view. Dropping to his knees in front of his best friend. Nat and Clint followed behind and did the same thing. Occupying themselves with the dog.

“We found you…” he gasped.

“Where are the others?”

“Back at the tower, we came out to try find out.”

Bucky nodded, getting a better look at his friend, he couldn’t help but snicker. The snicker soon growing into full blown laughter much to Steve’s confusment. Bucky triedto contain his amusement but he couldn’t, and laughter shook his body. Nat and Clint took one look at Steve and noticed it to.

“What’s so funny?”

“You um… you have a…” Bucky pointed just above Steve’s lip Where somehow he managed to gain a snowtash.

Steve chuckled, wiping it away as he waited for Bucky to calm down. It took a while, Bucky hadn’t laughed like that for ages but he was finally calm and ready to be serious.

“We need to head back, it’s not safe.” Steve sighed, rubbing his hands up and down his arms.

“I can’t… I can’t leave her out here.”

“Buck, you’ll freeze. Jarvis said you left hours ago! We thought you would have froze to death by now.”

“I would have if it weren’t for Bud.”

Steve glanced at the dog but didn’t say anything. Clint shuffled forward, only his eyes were visible through the heavy clothing he wore.

“Fury called us, he’s-“ “I don’t care what he said!” Bucky snapped.

“Barnes it’s not-“

Nat was cut off by Bud jumping up growling and barking behind Bucky. Turning around, he pulled out his gun, praying it wasn’t as he took aim. A figure slowly walked forward, before stopping just outside the lights reach. But they could see the eyes, Bucky knew them eyes. Dropping his gun, he held a hand out.

“(Y/N)…”

summary: Did anyone else notice that when Pepper called to Peter in his spider suit she referred to him as ‘Peter’? Not Spider-Man or...
body: Did anyone else notice that when Pepper called to Peter in his spider suit she referred to him as ‘Peter’? Not Spider-Man or anything. Peter. That means that Tony told her at some point and I hope to god it was before the snap because I would love to see how that conversation went.

reblog.comment: Did anyone else notice that when Pepper called to Peter in his spider suit she referred to him as ‘Peter’? Not Spider-Man or anything. Peter. That means that Tony told her at some point and I hope to god it was before the snap because I would love to see how that conversation went.

That means that Tony told her at some point and I hope to god it was before the snap because I would love to see how that conversation went.

blog.name: turtleperson44547
blog.title: TurtlePerson44547
blog.description: Welcome to my new blog. Here I’ll post stories, crossovers, one-shots and more! Feel free to request anything you want!

summary: Avengers - Sometime After The Snap Probably
title: Avengers - Sometime After The Snap Probably
body:
Bruce: So um... Might not be a good time but uh- what happened while I was in space?
Nat: *in the corner sobbing*
Clint: *Nowhere to be found*
Steve: Well you see Tony made a murder-bot and we fought it-
Bruce: Yeah, I was there for that bit but like what happened after it?
Rhodes: Minor case of paralysis. Something about an airport? It's all fuzzy man. 
Steve: Yeah Tony and I got into an argument 'cause my main pal Bucky killed his mum. So I started a war and- *Starts sobbing hysterically*
Bruce: Steve?
Steve: *With Nat in the corner* Bucky used to call me that!
Rocket: Jeez.

dialogue.name: Bruce
dialogue.label: Bruce:
dialogue.phrase: So um... Might not be a good time but uh- what happened while I was in space?

dialogue.name: Steve
dialogue.label: Steve:
dialogue.phrase: Well you see Tony made a murder-bot and we fought it-

dialogue.name: Bruce
dialogue.label: Bruce:
dialogue.phrase: Yeah, I was there for that bit but like what happened after it?

dialogue.name: Rhodes
dialogue.label: Rhodes:
dialogue.phrase: Minor case of paralysis. Something about an airport? It's all fuzzy man.

dialogue.name: Steve

summary: just, Endgame’s bullshit time travel means that they could have literally plucked a version of those who’d died out of the time...
body:
just, Endgame’s bullshit time travel means that they could have literally plucked a version of those who’d died out of the time stream and had them back.

They could have went back to like the day before Vision got uninstalled and got him back.

Hopped over to the day before Natasha got deep sixed and been like “get in loser we’re going timeline hopping”

Could have plucked a Tony out of like a month back and had him back too.

They could have done all of that, since Gamora from the past stayed in the future, and they just …. didn’t?

But Steve can go play Captain Husband in the past and it’s all good?

I call bullshit.

I call bullshit.

I call bullshit.

summary: I love how strong you were inside. I always see that quality shine in you. You were my reminder to be a little more brave, to...
body:
I love how strong you were inside. I always see that quality shine in you. You were my reminder to be a little more brave, to not be so afraid, and to remember that things will turn out okay in the long run.

I miss you, Natasha Romanoff.

My mentor.

My friend.

My sister.


  • So I’ve always thought Nat and Wanda would have bonded over the years and Nat would be like a mother/sister to Wanda. In Endgame when we got that very short scene with Clint and Wanda talking about Nat, I expected Wanda to say more, but it’s okay I guess.

blog.description: I have no idea how to do this so I'll just list stuff. Dyslexic. ASD. (Yes, I've been professionally tested.) GenderVoid. 1991. All walks of Superheroes. (My definition is wiggly.) Raised in Silicon Valley (My college peers acted like this was significant.) History is my soul. Japan. People interest me. My life goal is to be a history professor and make the WinterIron ship more popular.

tags: Like i might be misinterpreting history and the comics but I pretty sure it was a dumb line
summary: Stupidity At Its Finest
title: Stupidity At Its Finest
body:
Considering the more critical air of Steve Rogers in the fandom I feel comfortable sharing what I believe to be the stupidest line in all the Marvel movies. And although Steve says the line, this is not bashing on him. It’s bad writing plain and simple. Steve Rogers just says the line.

Okay. So in the first Avengers movie, Steve says, “You’re not the guy to make the sacrifice play. To lay down on the wire and let the other guy crawl over you.” Tony replies, “I think I’d just cut the wire.”

Anyone who knows anything about WW2 would understand with every atom in their body how stupid that line is. (Not that I’m an expert on the European theater of WW2. But considering what I do know…)

Quick history lesson. One of the many reasons America won WW2 is that they cut the wire and the Germans didn’t. What I mean is that the American government decided that winning was more important than pride. And the Germans– well a big part of Fascism’s MO is to romanticize the “Noble Death.”

Part of this was how the countries viewed hierarchy. For America, it was flexible (adaptable) and the government encouraged the sharing of information, of the different skills, and different ideas on how to win (or survive). The Nazis liked everyone to stay in their proper place and not move an inch. Very rigid. Thus, you killed an American CO, the second in command or whoever was still alive would continue the plan of attack or retreat. But killing the Nazi CO meant panic. Like a chicken with its head cut off.

So back to my point. A Nazi believing in the glorification of suicide would lay down on the wire. But an American would just cut the wire. If the guy whose job that usually was, was dead, then dollars to doughnuts he taught the skill to a mate. The Americans would cut the wire. Why die, if you can think of another way?

In other words, Steve Rogers WW2 soldier, saying that line… Like how? Why? That doesn’t make any sense. Considering, and I might have this wrong since I’m not a white Cap fan, in the comics Rogers is always going on about finding another option. To cut the metaphorical wire. It’s one of the reasons him and Tony are friends. Even if their methods differ. 

So yeah. Really fucking stupid line.  

P.S I’m not advocating that America were superheroes during WW2. Like yeah, they held the moral high ground over the Nazi. But that’s a pretty low bar. Not exactly something to brag about. Especially considering America’s less than stellar role before they entered the war.
